Description: Several fragments of a natural, yellow-tan coloured woven wool wrapping, fabric type B. The spinning direction of the warp and weft is 's' and the weave is plain and weft-faced. The thread count is 10 warp and 22 weft. The selvedge is reinforced (two element) and the edges are 's'-cord. Originally triangular in shape, the narrow end is finished with 25mm of countered twining (approx. ten rows) ending in a fringe 85mm long, knotted at the end. The fringe consists of two elements that are 's'-spun then 'z'-plied and eight 'z'-plied elements that are 's'-cabled.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p.61, 67)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1.171 (excavation object cat. no.)
